description.narrative:
Project-level Outcomes- The Project is expected to improve energy affordability to end-users as large utility companies tend to charge undifferentiated rates or capacity charges to their clients. On the other hand, retailers tend to provide customized offers, which can initiate a change in consumption patterns such as higher off-peak consumption. Off-peak consumption reduces the need for total peak capacity in the country, eventually decreases the need for standby thermal plants, and thereby reduces the associated charges included in end-user tariffs. IFC also expects the Project to support the country's climate mitigation agenda by improving access to cleaner energy more competitively and efficiently, thereby displacing high polluting, inefficient, and more expensive thermal generation and hence reduce associated carbon emissions.
Contribution to Market Creation- IFC's support to Vatia is expected to demonstrate energy retail companies like Vatia (beyond the incumbent large utility companies) can act as off-takers to renewable energy projects outside of the auction schemes, providing competition on price and service quality on the customer side, while reconciling the long-term certainty needs of renewable energy developers with the short-term certainty needs of end-customers. This is expected to promote renewable energy penetration and hence contributing towards the country's energy supply diversification.

The proposed investment consists in an up to US$10.0 million investment in the form of preferred equity in Vatia S.A E.S.P (Vatia or the Company), a Colombian electricity retailer / aggregator and a syndication of up to US$40 million in senior debt from local banks. The proceeds will allow Vatia to acquire 37MW of solar assets and provide equity to increase its trading and commercialization activities (the Project)
